info.name: Natours
info.description:
# API containing Tours, Users and Reviews data for a tour-selling website.

## Glossary

| **Icon** | **Meaning** | **Explanation** |
| --- | --- | --- |
| üÜî | Protected Route | Route only accessible for logged in users |
| üíÇ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è | Restricted Route | Route only accessible for users with specific permissions (based on user "role") |

item.name: Tours

request.description:
### Endpoint for getting all tours.

* * *

##### Data returned in the following format.

``` json
{
    "status": "success",
    "results": {number of valid results},
    "data": {array of valid results}
}

```

* * *

request.description:
### Endpoint for getting all tours (allowing query parameters).

* * *

##### Data returned in the following format:

``` json
{
    "status": "success",
    "results": {number of valid results},
    "data": {array of valid results}
}

```

* * *

##### Supported operators:

*   **\[gte\]** -> greater than or equal
*   **\[lte\]** -> less than or equal
*   **\[gt\]** -> greater than
*   **\[lt\]** -> less than
    

* * *

> The query parameters listed below (duration, difficulty and price) are mere examples. It is possible to query every document field in the Tour collection.

* * *

}


##### Results:

###### Are limited to

*   5 results
    

###### Are sorted by

*   Rating (descending)
*   Price (ascending)
    

* * *

request.description:
### Endpoint for getting tour statistics.

* * *

##### Data returned in the following format.

``` json
{
    "status": "success",
    "data": {array of stats}
}

```

* * *

##### Results:

###### Are grouped by

*   Difficulty
    

###### Contains

*   Average rating
*   Number of ratings
*   Number of tours
*   Average price
*   Minimum price
*   Maximum price
    

* * *

### Endpoint for getting the monthly plan.

#### Based on number of tours (considering starting dates) per month.

| üÜî | üíÇ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è **\- admin / lead-guide / guide** |
| --- | --- |

* * *

##### Data returned in the following format:

``` json
{
    "status": "success",
    "data": {array of results}
}

```

* * *

##### Results:

###### Are limited to

*   12 results
    

###### Are grouped by

*   Start dates (month)
    

###### Are sorted by

*   Number of tours starting in that given month (descending)
    

###### Contains

*   Number of Tours in that month
*   Tours names
*   Month name
    

* * *

##### Request parameter:

> {{URL}}api/v1/tours/monthly-plan/{{year}}

> **Year**  
> \> must contain 4 characters (YYYY)  
> \> example: 2021

* * *

response.name: Get Monthly Plan

request.description:
### Endpoint for getting tours within a given range.

* * *

##### Data returned in the following format:

``` json
{
    "status": "success",
    "results": {number of valid results},
    "data": {array of valid results}
}

```

* * *

##### Request parameters:

> {{URL}}api/v1/tours/tours-within/{{distance}}/center/{{latitude,longitude}}/unit/{{measurement_unit}}

> **Distance**  
> \> *should be informed in miles or kilometers*

> **Latitude and Longitude**  
> \> *point from where the distance will be calculated; point of origin*  
> \> *should be informed in this order, separated by a comma*

> **Measurement unit**  
> \> "mi" for distance in miles or "km" for distance in kilometers;  
> \> every parameter other than 'mi' will be considered as kilometers

* * *

request.description:
### Endpoint for getting tours sorted by distance from a given point.

#### Based on tour's start location.

* * *

##### Data returned in the following format:

``` json
{
    "status": "success",
    "results": {number of valid results},
    "data": {array of valid results}
}

```

* * *

##### Results:

###### Are sorted by

*   Distance (ascending - nearest first)
    

###### Contains

*   Tour Id
*   Tour name
*   Distance between given point (request parameter) and tour's start location
    

* * *

##### Request parameters:

> {{URL}}api/v1/tours/distances/{{latitude,longitute}}/unit/{{measurement_unit}}

> **Latitude and Longitude**  
> \> *point from where the distance will be calculated; point of origin*  
> \> *should be informed in this order (lat, long), separated by a comma*

> **Measurement unit**  
> \> "mi" for distance in miles or "km" for distance in kilometers;  
> \> every parameter other than 'mi' will be considered as kilometers

* * *

request.description:
### Endpoint for retrieving an account not knowing the correct password.

* * *

##### Body:

###### Must contain

``` json
{
    "email": {{registered email}}
}

```

* * *

#### If the provided email is registered in the database, a token number will be sent to the registered email.

#### The token must be used in "api/v1/users/resetPassword/:token" route.

* * *

##### Data returned in the following format:

``` json
{
    "status": "success",
    "message": "Password reset token sent via email."
}

```

* * *

### Endpoint for creating a new user.

* * *

##### Body:

###### Must contain

``` json
{
    "name": {{user name}},
    "email": {{user email}},
    "password": {{desired password}},
    "passwordConfirm": {{desired password confirmation}}
}

```

* * *

##### Data returned in the following format:

``` json
{
    "status": "success",
    "token": {JWT token},
    "data": {created user data}
}

```

* * *

### Endpoint for updating the current user's password .

#### Works only for password updates.

| **üÜî** |
| --- |

* * *

##### Body:

###### Must contain

``` json
{
    "oldPassword": {{old but valid password}},
    "password": {{new desired password}},
    "passwordConfirm": {{new desired password confirmation}}
}

```

* * *

##### Data returned in the following format:

``` json
{
    "status": "success",
    "token": {JWT token},
    "data": {updated current user data}
}

```

* * *

### Endpoint for resetting an account's password.

> *Must be used after "api/v1/users/forgotPassword".*

* * *

##### Body:

###### Must contain

``` json
{
    "password": {{new desired password}},
    "passwordConfirm": {{new desired password confirmation}}
}

```

* * *

##### Data returned in the following format:

``` json
{
    "status": "success",
    "token": {JWT Token}
}

```

* * *

##### Request parameters:

> {{URL}}api/v1/users/resetPassword/{{token}}

> **Token**  
> \> Received via e-mail, after requesting "api/v1/users/forgotPassword" if a valid email is provided.

* * *
